ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: Tavatron caught the full blow of Dinobot s strike. But instead of flying back against the tree she sumersalted in midair and vaulted off the tree. Beast

Tavatron caught the full blow of Dinobot's strike. But instead of flying 
back against the tree she sumersalted in midair and vaulted off the tree.

"Beast Mode!" Tavatron transformed in midair, mech-fluid flowing from her 
wounded torso, she rammed into Dinobot's chest. This time, however, she 
remembered to jump back so that Dinobot couldn't grab her again.

"Maximize!" Tavatron unsheathed her drill sword, with narrowed optics she 
said:

"A warrior does not run from battle!" Tavatron pressed her free hand against 
her injured waist, trying to slow the flow of mech-fluid.

>From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>
>Reply-To: nbwrpg@egroups.com
>To: nbwrpg@egroups.com
>Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
>Date: Sun, 16 Apr 2000 02:20:53 PDT
>
>* Dinobot knew that Tavatron wouldn't move and advanced towards her, his 15
>inch raptor claws fully extended from his clawed hands.
>He looked at her with his one good eye, the laser sight aimed at her head.
>He wouldn't shoot at her because he knew that this was a practice battle,
>but he wasn't sure if she knew that any longer.
>Weather Tavatron noticed or not, he hadn't caused a single drop of mech
>fluid to come from her body yet here he was...fluid dripping from his leg
>and almost gushing from his wounded eye.He had to admit, she was good, much
>better then he had first thought!
>Soon his rage was replaced by the need to battle again, to get back into
>action. The simple passion to FIGHT!*
>
>" Good, very good," he then narrowed his optics at Tavatron, " but not good
>enough!!!"
>
>
>Dinobot snarled and roared again, he sprang into the air and came down hard
>with a side swipe to Tavatron's torso with his wickedly sharp claws.
>However, he was conscious of how much power he used as not to cause any
>fatal damage. With 67% of his power behind the hit he was sure that it 
>would
>send her into the nearby trees and with damage to boot!
>Now, the true test began!*
>
